Articles.Content: Any way to recover from tumbling while on eva quicker? My craft was spinning, and try to get back on board, ship hit my kerbal and just spun for like a minute. Why cant he use the RCS to stabilize ?
Kind of cheating, but you can use time warp to stop rotation.

28 minutes ago, worir4 said:

Kind of cheating, but you can use time warp to stop rotation.

Yes this^^

Because of the way time warp works it freezes all rotation, and it doesn't restart when you stop warping.

So just tap the > key and then the < key a few seconds later.  Yes it is 'cheating' in a way, but its a standard feature of how the stock game works so its kind of not either.  I do it all the time.

because you probably didn't put a probe that can enable SAS when kerbal is absent.

btw if there's no mechanism to stabilize, it will just spin forever - it's not a problem of a "quicker"

1 hour ago, Conbadicus said:

Any way to recover from tumbling while on eva quicker? My craft was spinning, and try to get back on board, ship hit my kerbal and just spun for like a minute. Why cant he use the RCS to stabilize ? 

To answer your question more directly, I think the idea is that when a Kerbal has been struck hard enough he's either too dazed, disoriented or stunned to respond for a bit. So it's not that his RCS doesn't work or isn't operating, it's just that he's incapable of utilizing it.
^ This. Just wait five seconds or so. It's an intentional mechanic meant to train you to be careful ;P

Ok, i made the post because its not a 5 second daze, it lasts quite a long time.

For example, falling out of lander on mun and sliding alllllll the way down a crater.... took like a minute.

Currently sliding down a crater, over 1.5km from where i originally started sliding....
